newsitem.title: USA: U.S. barge rates steady to higher on call session.
newsitem.headline: U.S. barge rates steady to higher on call session.

text.p: U.S. barge rates were mostly steady to higher on Monday on the St. Louis Merchants Exchange call session. No barges traded versus no trades Friday.
- Two barges, this week, lower Ohio, no bid, offered 95 percent - up five percentage points.
- Two barges, next week, Mississippi (Clayton, Iowa), bid 100 percent, offered 115 - no comparison.
- Two barges, next week, Mississippi (St Paul-Savage), bid 127-1/2 percent - no comparison, no offer.
- Eight barges, two each week of September, mid-Mississippi, bid 142-1/2 - no comparison, no offer.
- Four barges, two each week of October 6 and 13, mid Mississippi, bid 205 percent - up 2-1/2 points from Thursday's bid, offered 220 - up 7-1/2 from Thursday.
- Eight barges, two each week of October, mid Mississippi, bid 215 percent - unchanged, no comparison.
- Eight barges, two each week of October, Illinois, bid 210 percent - unchanged from similar bid, no offer.
- Eight barges, two each week Nov 17 and 24, Mississippi (Clinton and south), bid 200 percent - unchanged, no offer.
